instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2442: What is A2442? A2442 is a model number for a 14 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2021 M1 with EMC 3650, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-02098..
definitions.820-02098: What is 820-02098? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: SOLVED: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2442</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02098</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Spilled liquid. 20V 0.004A - Turns on the loading screen with accounts and power cycles multiple times
threads.message:
No heat signature, dead cold.

First connected its power cycles to 20V 0.16A - loads the system, power cycles then repeats.
Seems like it cuts off at some point, but can't detect any shorts around CD32s and major lines.

liquid impacted areas are:
LP800
UG800
UH802/908
<CHIP>U2020</CHIP> 
CE501/515
JH500 and slightly around UG400 but can't detect any shorts or corroded parts there.

Where shall I start?

threads.title: SOLVED: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2442</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02098</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Spilled liquid. 20V 0.004A - Turns on the loading screen with accounts and power cycles multiple times
threads.message: If no important data, go for DFU restore; else, revive.

threads.title: SOLVED: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2442</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02098</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Spilled liquid. 20V 0.004A - Turns on the loading screen with accounts and power cycles multiple times
threads.message: No luck in reaching DFU mode. Followed the guide and also tried different macs in case.

threads.message: Did you try wire method on DFU pads?

threads.message: havent heard of that. Do yu have a link?

SOLVED: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2442</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02098</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Spilled liquid. 20V 0.004A - Turns on the loading screen with accounts and power cycles multiple times
threads.message:
None of the DFU attempts succeeded. Maybe not DFu issue?

What I get now is it goes 20V 2A while charging the battery.
Since it's charged it makes the ding noise like charging the Mac and stays at Goes 5V-20V 0.01A and resets the USBc meters, then dign again and repeats 3 times until settles on 5V 0.001A

threads.title: SOLVED: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2442</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02098</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Spilled liquid. 20V 0.004A - Turns on the loading screen with accounts and power cycles multiple times
threads.message: Possibly accumulated crap under some BGA chips...

threads.title: SOLVED: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2442</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02098</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Spilled liquid. 20V 0.004A - Turns on the loading screen with accounts and power cycles multiple times
threads.message:
Thanks [USER=682]@2informaticos[/USER] as always straight to the spot.
UC resolved the issue. Additionally, reballed UG800 in case, as there was a liquid indication around it.
